metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6826 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Tyson Smith, Bob Clary, and Alexandru Michis reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 74. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 75.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
